author: asianlego
title: Move The Great Thinkers
review:
You'll need these if you want your robots to move. Most likely you already have this because most people buy a complete NXT set, but people who buy only NXT-special pieces like this don't so they need one. It has a nice name, Interactive Servo Motor and the name alone can impress anyone you are talking to about it with. (Haha)

-asianlego

author: sparramc
title: What was LEGO Thinking?
review:
What was LEGO Thinking when the came up with the NXT Motor design? Simply, it's a hideous result of some deranged engineers that have been lokked up for far too long!

The Motor it's self mechanically is excellent. But, the problem arrives as soon as you attempt to fit it in/around your Robot. Most of us want to build more than "ALPHA REX" with our Mindstorms NXT Kit.

LEGO would have been far better of using PowerFunction type Motors with Encoders.
I often use PowerFunction Motors in place of NXT Motors where motor position feedback isn't required. Also PowerFunction Motors can be used with a RCX Type Rotation Sensor if needed.

Besides the Sound Sensor in the NXT v1.0 kit and the NXT Motors, the LEGO Mindstorms NXT Kit is an amazing platform which I highly recommend..

www.rjmcnamara.com for my LEGO Mindstorms NXT Bots.
